page.title: 02MONKS FARMS AND COTTAGES
page.content: Whilst this area does not contain any stately homes,its development can be traced back through the centuries by the many old buildings to be found in it. The oldest is{Springfield Grange once known as{Monks Grange.}It was a Benedictine outpost and dates from the 13th. century. Most of the very old buildings are farms as is to be expected of a rural area, and those still inhabited today include Babylon Farm from the 15th century, Coldwell Cottage-now known as The Moat-which is 16th. century.Hay Farm, Cugley and The Oaks are all 17th century. Green's Farm and Queen Anne Cottage, one of the few thatched cottages in the block, are 18th century. Many of the now modernised cottages also date from earlier centuries and many still retain old features.
